name: Goblet Squat
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out.
Hold a dumbbell vertically against your chest with both hands.
Brace your core and keep your chest upright.
Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat.
Descend until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
Push through your heels to return to standing, keeping the dumbbell stable.

name: Pallof Press
instructions: Anchor a resistance band at chest level.
Stand sideways to the anchor, holding the band in both hands.
Press straight out from your chest, resisting rotation.
Hold for 2 seconds, return and repeat.

name: Bent-Over Dumbbell Row
instructions: Hold dumbbells, hinge at hips with a flat back.
Let arms hang down, then pull weights toward ribs.
Squeeze shoulder blades at the top, lower slowly.

name: Bear Crawl
instructions: Get on hands and toes, knees close to ground.
Step opposite hand and foot forward for 3 small steps.
Reverse direction after 3 steps while keeping low and controlled.

name: Dead Bug
instructions: Lie flat on your back, knees and hips at 90 degrees, arms pointing straight up.
Brace your core and press your lower back into the floor.
Slowly extend one leg and the opposite arm toward the ground.
Return to the starting position and switch sides.

name: Lateral Lunge
instructions: Stand tall with feet together and arms at sides.
Take a wide step to the side with your right leg, bending the right knee.
Push your hips back and keep the left leg straight.
Push off your right foot to return to the start and repeat on the other side.

name: Push-Up to Shoulder Tap
instructions: Begin in a plank position with hands directly under shoulders.
Lower into a push-up, keeping elbows close to the body.
Push back up, then lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder.
Repeat, alternating sides with each tap.

name: Jump Squat
instructions: Start in a squat position with feet shoulder-width apart.
Lower into a full squat, then jump up explosively.
Land softly back into a squat, ready for the next rep.

name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Begin in a high plank position.
Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs.
Continue alternating rapidly while maintaining good plank form.

name: Band Face Pull
instructions: Anchor band at upper chest height.
Pull the band toward your face, elbows high and wide.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together, then return with control.

name: Glute Bridge
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Place arms at your sides, palms down.
Drive through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
Squeeze your glutes at the top, then lower slowly back down.

name: High Knees
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Quickly run in place, lifting knees as high as possible.
Swing arms for balance and speed.
Maintain a brisk pace for the duration.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
instructions: Sit or stand with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
Press the dumbbells overhead until arms are fully extended.
Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control.

name: Side Plank
instructions: Lie on your side and prop yourself up on your elbow.
Stack your feet and lift your hips off the ground.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Hold the position while engaging your core.

name: Speed Skaters
instructions: Start in a slight squat position.
Leap laterally to one side, landing on the opposite foot.
Swing arms for momentum and balance.
Repeat side to side continuously.

name: Resistance Band Row
instructions: Anchor the band at chest height.
Grab both ends and step back to create tension.
Pull the band toward your torso, elbows driving back.
Squeeze your shoulder blades, then return slowly.

name: Calf Raise
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart.
Push through the balls of your feet to raise your heels.
Hold briefly at the top, then lower slowly.
Use a wall or chair for balance if needed.

name: Burpee
target: Full body, especially chest, legs, and core
instructions: Begin standing, then drop into a squat and place your hands on the floor.
Jump your feet back into a plank position.
Do a push-up, then jump feet back to hands.
Explode upward into a jump and repeat.

name: Wall Sit
instructions: Stand with back flat against a wall.
Slide down until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
Keep knees over ankles and hold the position.
Maintain a flat back and tight core throughout.

name: Plank to Elbow Tap
instructions: Begin in a high plank position.
Tap your left elbow with your right hand, return.
Repeat on the other side while keeping your hips stable.
Maintain plank form throughout the movement.

name: Reverse Lunge
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Step one leg straight back, lowering your back knee towards the floor.
Keep your front knee stacked over your ankle.
Push through your front heel to return to standing.
Alternate legs with each rep.

name: Step-Up
instructions: Stand in front of a sturdy bench or riser.
Place one foot entirely on the bench.
Drive through the heel of your elevated foot to step onto the bench.
Bring your back foot up to meet the front foot, then step down with control.
Repeat on one side before switching, or alternate.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat (Bodyweight)
instructions: Stand a few feet in front of a low bench or sturdy chair.
Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you.
Keep your chest upright and core braced.
Lower your body by bending your front knee until your back knee is close to the floor.
Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Complete all reps on one leg before switching.

name: Single Leg Deadlift (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in one hand.
Stand on the opposite leg, with a slight bend in the knee.
Hinge at your hips, extending your free leg straight back for balance.
Lower the dumbbell towards the floor, keeping your back straight.
Squeeze your glute to return to standing, maintaining balance.

name: Incline Push-Up
instructions: Place your hands on a sturdy elevated surface (e.g., wall, bench, sturdy table) slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step your feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
Lower your chest towards the surface by bending your elbows.
Push through your hands to return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
instructions: Stand or sit holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended by your sides, palms facing forward.
Keeping your elbows close to your body, curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders.
Squeeze your biceps at the top, then slowly lower the weights back to the start.

name: Dumbbell Triceps Kickback
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in one hand. Hinge forward at your hips, keeping your back straight.
Tuck your elbow close to your side, forming a 90-degree angle.
Extend your forearm straight back until your arm is fully straight, squeezing the triceps.
Slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Resistance Band Pull Apart
instructions: Hold a light resistance band with both hands, palms facing down, hands about shoulder-width apart.
Keep your arms straight at chest height.
Pull the band apart, squeezing your shoulder blades together, until your arms are out to the sides.
Slowly control the band back to the starting position.

name: Push-Up
instructions: Start in a plank position with hands directly under shoulders, body in a straight line.
Lower your chest towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them tucked slightly.
Push through your hands to return to the starting plank position.
Perform on knees if a full push-up is too challenging initially.

name: Bird-Dog
instructions: Start on your hands and knees, wrists under shoulders, knees under hips.
Brace your core, keeping your back flat.
Slowly extend one arm straight forward and the opposite leg straight back.
Keep your hips level and avoid rotating your torso.
Return to the start with control and switch sides.

name: Leg Raises (lying)
instructions: Lie flat on your back, hands under your lower back for support if needed.
Keep your legs straight and together.
Slowly raise your legs towards the ceiling until they are vertical or your hips start to lift.
Lower your legs back down with control, stopping just before they touch the floor.

name: Flutter Kicks
instructions: Lie on your back with your hands under your lower back for support.
Lift both legs slightly off the ground (about 6-12 inches).
Keeping your legs straight, rapidly alternate lifting one leg higher than the other in a small, controlled motion.
Keep your lower back pressed into the floor.

name: Russian Twist (Bodyweight)
instructions: Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
Lean back slightly, engaging your core, and lift your feet off the ground.
Clasp your hands together in front of your chest.
Rotate your torso from side to side, tapping your hands lightly on the floor beside your hips.
Keep your core tight and back straight.

name: Plank Hip Dips
instructions: Start in an elbow plank position, forearms on the ground, body in a straight line.
Keep your core tight and glutes squeezed.
Slowly lower one hip towards the floor, rotating your torso slightly.
Return to the center plank, then lower the opposite hip.
Alternate sides, maintaining control.

name: Jumping Jacks
instructions: Start standing with feet together and arms at your sides.
Simultaneously jump your feet out wide while swinging your arms overhead.
Immediately jump back to the starting position.
Maintain a steady, rhythmic pace.

name: Butt Kicks
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Rapidly 'run' in place, actively trying to kick your heels back to touch your glutes.
Pump your arms as if sprinting to increase intensity.
Maintain a light, quick pace.

name: Shadow Boxing (Light)
instructions: Stand with a slight athletic stance, knees slightly bent.
Perform various punches (jabs, crosses, hooks, uppercuts) into the air.
Incorporate footwork like shuffling, pivots, and weaving.
Focus on smooth, continuous movement and light on your feet, like you're fighting an imaginary opponent.

name: Broad Jump
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent.
Swing your arms back and quickly bend your knees, loading up for the jump.
Explode forward and up, jumping as far as you can.
Land softly on both feet, absorbing the impact by bending your knees.

name: Plyometric Push-Up (Modified)
instructions: Start in a standard push-up position (or on knees for modification).
Lower your chest towards the floor.
Explosively push up, trying to lift your hands off the floor slightly.
Land softly and immediately go into the next rep.

name: Cat-Cow Stretch
instructions: Start on your hands and knees, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
**Cat:** Exhale as you round your spine towards the ceiling, tucking your chin to your chest.
**Cow:** Inhale as you drop your belly towards the floor, lifting your head and tailbone.
Flow smoothly between the two positions.

name: Thoracic Rotation (Kneeling)
instructions: Kneel on the floor with your knees wide, big toes touching. Sit back on your heels.
Place one hand on the back of your head, elbow pointing forward.
Place the other hand on the floor in front of you.
Rotate your upper body, lifting your elbow towards the ceiling.
Return slowly and repeat, focusing on the rotation in your mid-back.

name: Scapular Push-Up
instructions: Start in a high plank position with straight arms, hands directly under shoulders.
Keeping your arms straight, let your chest drop slightly by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Then, push away from the floor by rounding your upper back, spreading your shoulder blades apart.
Only your shoulder blades should move; your elbows remain locked.

name: Hollow Body Hold
instructions: Lie flat on your back, arms extended overhead, legs straight.
Press your lower back firmly into the floor (no gap!).
Lift your head, shoulders, and legs slightly off the floor.
Engage your core tightly to maintain the position, keeping your body in a slight 'rocker' shape.

name: L-Sit Tuck Progression
instructions: Sit on the floor with your hands planted firmly beside your hips, fingers pointing forward.
Push through your hands to lift your hips and feet off the floor.
Tuck your knees towards your chest, keeping your arms straight and shoulders depressed.
Hold this 'tuck L-sit' position for the desired duration, focusing on core engagement.

name: Crab Walk
instructions: Sit on the floor with knees bent, feet flat, and hands on the floor behind you, fingers pointing forward.
Lift your hips off the ground, forming a 'crab' position.
Move forward by alternating opposite hand and foot.
Maintain elevated hips and a stable core throughout.

name: Arm Circles
instructions: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart.
Extend your arms straight out to your sides at shoulder height.
Make small, controlled circles with your arms, gradually increasing the size.
Perform circles in one direction, then reverse the direction.
Keep your core engaged and avoid shrugging your shoulders.

name: Inchworm
instructions: Stand tall with straight legs.
Hinge at your hips and walk your hands out in front of you into a plank position.
Keep your core tight and hips stable.
Once in a full plank, slowly walk your feet towards your hands, keeping legs as straight as possible.
Stand up fully, then repeat.

name: Plank Shoulder Taps (Alternating)
instructions: Start in a high plank position, hands under shoulders, body in a straight line.
Brace your core and squeeze your glutes to keep your hips stable.
Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder, minimizing hip movement.
Return the hand to the floor and repeat on the other side.
Alternate sides with control.

name: Thruster (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing in, elbows tucked.
Perform a full squat, keeping chest up.
As you stand up from the squat, explosively press the dumbbells overhead until arms are straight.
Lower dumbbells back to shoulders as you descend into the next squat.
This is one fluid movement.

name: Walking Lunge
instructions: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
Take a large step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about 90 degrees.
Push off your back foot and bring it forward to meet the front foot.
Immediately step forward with the other leg into the next lunge.
Continue walking forward, alternating legs.

name: Plank Jacks
instructions: Start in a high plank position.
Keeping your core tight and hips stable, jump both feet out wide, similar to a jumping jack.
Immediately jump your feet back together.
Maintain a straight body line and controlled movement throughout.

name: Box Jumps (Low Box)
instructions: Stand facing a sturdy low box or step, about a foot away.
Swing your arms back and bend your knees, then explode up onto the box.
Land softly with both feet fully on the box, bending your knees to absorb impact.
Step down or jump back carefully to the starting position.

name: Knee Push-Up
instructions: Start on your hands and knees, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to knees (no sagging hips).
Lower your chest towards the floor by bending your elbows.
Push through your hands to return to the starting position.

name: Side Shuffle (Athletic Stance)
instructions: Set two markers about 10-20 feet apart.
Start at one marker in an athletic stance.
Shuffle quickly sideways to the other marker, touching it with your hand.
Immediately shuffle back to the starting marker.
Stay low and move with quick, short steps rather than long strides.

name: Superman
instructions: Lie face down on the floor with arms extended straight overhead and legs straight.
Engage your core and glutes.
Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs a few inches off the floor.
Hold for 1-2 seconds, feeling the squeeze in your lower back and glutes.
Lower slowly back to the starting position.

name: Standing Band Rotation
instructions: Anchor a resistance band at chest height to your side.
Stand sideways to the anchor, holding the band with both hands out in front of you.
Rotate your torso away from the anchor, keeping your arms straight and hips relatively still.
Control the rotation back to the starting position.

name: Split Jumps (Lunge Jumps)
instructions: Start in a lunge position with one leg forward, one leg back, both knees bent at 90 degrees.
Explosively jump straight up, switching your leg positions in mid-air.
Land softly back into a lunge with the opposite leg forward.
Continue alternating quickly and maintain control.

name: Quadruped Hip Extension
instructions: Start on your hands and knees, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Keeping your knee bent at 90 degrees, lift one leg directly behind you, squeezing your glute.
Lift until your thigh is parallel to the floor, or slightly higher.
Lower with control to the starting position.
Complete all reps on one leg before switching.

name: Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and hands behind your head or crossed over your chest.
Engage your core and lift your head and shoulders off the floor, curling your rib cage towards your pelvis.
Avoid pulling on your neck.
Lower slowly back down with control.

name: Reverse Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back, knees bent, feet off the floor, forming a 90-degree angle at the hips and knees.
Hands can be at your sides or under your lower back for support.
Using your lower abs, lift your hips slightly off the floor, bringing your knees closer to your chest.
Lower slowly back down with control.

name: Single-Leg Glute Bridge
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat. Extend one leg straight up.
Drive through the heel of the planted foot to lift your hips.
Squeeze your glute at the top, maintaining level hips.
Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Pistol Squat Progression (Assisted)
instructions: Stand on one leg, extending the other forward. Hold onto a sturdy object (doorframe, pole) for balance.
Slowly lower into a squat on one leg, keeping your chest up and back straight.
Use your assistance minimally to control the descent and push back up.
Go as deep as comfortable, keeping the extended leg off the floor.

name: Sumo Squat (Bodyweight)
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, toes pointed out at 45 degrees.
Keep your chest upright and core engaged.
Lower into a squat, pushing your knees out over your toes.
Descend until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
Push through your heels to return to standing.

name: Good Mornings (Bodyweight)
instructions: Stand tall with a slight bend in your knees.
Place hands behind your head or crossed on your chest.
Hinge at your hips, pushing your glutes back as your torso lowers towards parallel with the floor.
Keep your back flat and core tight. Feel the stretch in your hamstrings.
Squeeze your glutes to return to standing.

name: Plank with Leg Lift
instructions: Start in a high plank position, body in a straight line.
Keep your core tight and hips level.
Slowly lift one leg straight up a few inches, without letting your hips twist.
Hold briefly, then lower with control and switch sides.

name: Flutter Kicks (Standing)
instructions: Stand tall with good posture.
Rapidly kick your legs forward and backward in short, quick movements.
Keep your core engaged and arms pumping lightly.
Focus on speed and maintaining balance.

name: Alternating Arm & Leg Swings (Dynamic)
instructions: Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart.
Swing one leg forward and backward, gradually increasing height.
Simultaneously swing the opposite arm in rhythm with the leg.
Control the swing; avoid just letting gravity take over.
After reps, switch to the other side.

name: Spiderman Lunge with Rotation
instructions: Start in a high plank position.
Step one foot outside your hand, into a deep lunge.
Place the hand on the same side as the forward foot on the floor.
Rotate your torso and reach your free arm towards the ceiling.
Return the hand, step back to plank, and repeat on the other side.

name: Thread the Needle
instructions: Start on all fours (hands and knees).
Reach one arm under your body, palm facing up, threading it through the gap between your other arm and leg.
Lower your shoulder and head to the floor.
Feel the stretch in your shoulder and upper back. Hold briefly.
Push back up and repeat on the other side.

name: World's Greatest Stretch
target: Hips, Hamstrings, Thoracic Spine, Quads, Ankles
instructions: Start in a high plank. Step one foot outside your hand (Spiderman Lunge).
Drop the elbow on the same side as the front foot towards the floor.
Then, rotate your torso, reaching the hand towards the ceiling.
Step back to plank. Repeat on the other side.
This is a flowing movement, hitting many areas.

name: Kneeling Band Triceps Extension
instructions: Kneel on the floor. Anchor a resistance band high (e.g., around a door handle).
Grab the band with both hands, palms facing each other, arms bent, elbows tucked.
Press the band down and back, extending your arms fully, squeezing your triceps.
Control the band slowly back to the starting position.

name: Band Assisted Pull-Up (Modified)
instructions: Loop a resistance band over a sturdy bar (or attach to door anchor high).
Place one or both knees into the loop (or one foot if using a single loop).
Hang with arms fully extended, then pull your chest towards the band/bar.
Lower with control, allowing the band to assist.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
instructions: Lie on your back on the floor, knees bent, feet flat.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand, elbows on the floor at shoulder height, palms facing in or forward.
Press the dumbbells straight up towards the ceiling, squeezing your chest.
Lower with control until your triceps lightly touch the floor.

name: Dumbbell Farmers Carry
instructions: Hold a heavy dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight at your sides.
Stand tall, chest up, shoulders back, core braced.
Walk slowly and deliberately, maintaining good posture.
Keep your steps controlled and avoid leaning.

name: Half-Kneeling Chop (Band)
instructions: Kneel with one knee up (90-degree angle at hip and knee), the other knee down.
Anchor a resistance band high and to the side of your kneeling position.
Grab the band with both hands, extend arms, and chop the band diagonally down and across your body.
Control the band back to the start, resisting rotation.
Complete all reps on one leg before switching.

name: Single Leg Calf Raise
instructions: Stand on one foot, holding onto a wall or chair for balance if needed.
Keep the standing leg straight (but not locked).
Push through the ball of your foot to raise your heel as high as possible.
Hold briefly at the top, then lower slowly with control.

name: Box Squat (to Bench)
instructions: Stand in front of a sturdy box or bench, feet shoulder-width apart.
Initiate the squat by pushing your hips back as if to sit down.
Lower yourself with control until your glutes lightly touch the box/bench.
Maintain tension, then push through your heels to stand back up without resting on the box.

name: Seated Good Mornings (Band)
instructions: Sit on the floor with legs straight and a resistance band around your upper back/neck, holding the ends.
Keep your back straight and core engaged.
Hinge forward from your hips, stretching your hamstrings.
Return to the upright seated position, squeezing your glutes.

name: High Plank Row (Dumbbell)
instructions: Start in a high plank position with hands on dumbbells, feet wide for stability.
Keep your core tight and hips stable (avoid rocking).
Row one dumbbell up towards your rib cage, squeezing your shoulder blade.
Lower with control and repeat on the other side, alternating.

name: Dumbbell Renegade Row
instructions: Start in a high plank position with hands on dumbbells, feet wide.
Row one dumbbell up towards your rib cage, minimizing hip movement.
Keep your core extremely tight to resist rotation.
Lower with control and switch sides.

name: Close-Grip Push-Up
instructions: Start in a plank position with hands directly under your shoulders, or slightly narrower.
Lower your chest towards the floor, keeping your elbows tucked close to your body.
Push through your hands to return to the starting position.
Focus on feeling it in your triceps.

name: Pike Push-Up
instructions: Start in a high plank, then walk your feet closer to your hands, lifting your hips high into an inverted V-shape.
Bend your elbows, lowering the crown of your head towards the floor between your hands.
Push back up to the starting pike position.
This is a progression towards handstand push-ups.

name: Tricep Dips (Bench)
instructions: Sit on the edge of a sturdy bench or chair, hands next to your hips, fingers gripping the edge.
Slide your hips off the bench, supporting your weight with your hands.
Bend your elbows, lowering your body straight down until your arms are at a 90-degree angle.
Push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Triceps Extension (Standing)
instructions: Stand tall, hold one dumbbell with both hands, extended overhead.
Keep elbows pointing forward and close to your head.
Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows.
Extend your arms back up to the starting position, squeezing your triceps.

name: Standing Band Chest Press
instructions: Anchor a resistance band behind you at chest height.
Grab both ends of the band and face away from the anchor.
Stand in a staggered stance for stability.
Press the band straight forward from your chest, extending your arms fully.
Control the band back to your chest slowly.

name: Jump Rope
instructions: Hold rope handles, spin rope overhead, and jump over it with small, light jumps.
Keep elbows close to your body, wrists doing most of the work.
Maintain a consistent rhythm and light footwork.
Vary between two-foot jumps, single-leg, or high knees.

name: Shuffle Sprints
instructions: Set two markers about 10-20 feet apart.
Start at one marker in an athletic stance.
Shuffle quickly sideways to the other marker, touching it with your hand.
Immediately shuffle back to the starting marker.
Stay low and move with quick, explosive steps.

name: Pop Squats
instructions: Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart.
Jump your feet out wide into a squat stance (toes pointed slightly out).
Immediately jump your feet back together.
Maintain a continuous, explosive rhythm.

name: Skydiver (Superman Variation)
instructions: Lie face down, arms bent, hands by your head (like a skydiver).
Engage your core and glutes.
Lift your chest, arms, and legs off the floor.
Hold briefly, squeezing your entire posterior chain.
Lower slowly and repeat.

name: Bird Dog with Elbow to Knee
instructions: Start on hands and knees. Extend one arm forward and opposite leg back.
Bring the extended elbow and knee together underneath your body, crunching your core.
Re-extend with control, then return to start and switch sides.

name: Standing Side Bend (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand tall, feet hip-width apart. Hold one dumbbell in one hand.
Keep your back straight and core tight.
Slowly bend to the side with the dumbbell, allowing it to slide down your leg.
Use your obliques to pull your torso back upright.
Complete all reps on one side, then switch.

name: Glute March
instructions: Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat, hips raised in a glute bridge position.
Keep your hips level and stable.
Slowly lift one foot off the floor, bringing the knee towards your chest.
Lower the foot with control, then alternate legs, minimizing hip drop.

name: Kneeling Ankle Mobility Circles
instructions: Kneel on one knee, with the other foot flat on the floor in front of you.
Lean forward, pushing your knee over your toes, without lifting your heel.
Make slow, controlled circles with your knee, mobilizing your ankle.
Reverse direction, then switch legs.

name: Leg Sweeps (Dynamic)
instructions: Hold onto a wall or sturdy object for balance.
Swing one leg forward and backward, gradually increasing height.
Then, swing the same leg side-to-side across your body.
Control the movement throughout. Switch legs after all sweeps.

name: Dynamic Chest Stretch (Arm Swings)
instructions: Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart.
Swing both arms forward and across your body, then open them wide to the sides, feeling a stretch in your chest.
Maintain a controlled, rhythmic motion.
Avoid over-extending or shrugging your shoulders.

name: Cossack Squat (Assisted)
target: Inner Thighs, Glutes, Hamstrings, Ankle Mobility
instructions: Stand with feet wide, toes pointed slightly out. Hold onto something for balance if needed.
Shift your weight to one side, bending that knee and keeping the other leg straight.
Lower your hips towards the bent knee, keeping your straight leg's heel on the ground.
Go as deep as comfortable, then push back to center and switch sides.

name: Forearm Plank (Low Plank)
instructions: Lie on your stomach. Prop yourself up on your forearms, elbows directly under shoulders.
Push through your forearms and toes to lift your body into a straight line.
Keep your core tight, glutes squeezed, and avoid letting your hips sag or rise too high.
Maintain a neutral spine and gaze towards the floor.

name: Static Lunge Hold
instructions: Step into a lunge position, with both knees bent at approximately 90 degrees.
Ensure your front knee is over your ankle and your back knee is hovering just above the floor.
Keep your chest upright and core engaged.
Hold this static position, feeling the burn in your quads and glutes. Switch legs.

name: Dumbbell Fly (Floor)
instructions: Lie on your back on the floor, knees bent, feet flat.
Hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended straight up over your chest, palms facing each other.
With a slight bend in your elbows, slowly lower the dumbbells out to the sides until your upper arms touch the floor.
Squeeze your chest to bring the dumbbells back together over your chest.

name: Resistance Band Rotational Punch
instructions: Anchor a resistance band at shoulder height to your side.
Stand sideways to the anchor in an athletic stance, holding the band with the hand furthest from the anchor.
Rotate your hips and torso as you punch straight forward, extending your arm.
Control the return, resisting the band pulling you back. Focus on the core twist.

name: Kneeling Around the World (Mobility)
instructions: Kneel on the floor. Extend one arm straight forward, thumb up.
Draw a large circle with your arm, reaching it up, back, and down.
Try to keep your torso stable and only move your arm and shoulder.
Reverse the direction, then switch arms.

name: Dynamic Pigeon Pose (Flow)
instructions: Start on all fours. Bring one knee forward and place it behind the wrist of the same side, with your shin angled.
Extend the back leg straight behind you.
Gently rock forward and backward, or from side to side, easing into the hip stretch.
Focus on relaxing the hip. Switch sides after all reps.

name: Lying Windshield Wipers
instructions: Lie on your back, arms spread wide to the sides, palms down.
Bring your knees up towards your chest, keeping them bent at 90 degrees.
Keeping your shoulders on the floor, slowly lower your knees to one side, like windshield wipers.
Go as far as comfortable without lifting shoulders. Bring back to center and switch sides.

name: Push-Up Hold (Isometric)
instructions: Get into a push-up position.
Lower your chest until it's just a few inches from the floor (or at a 90-degree elbow bend).
Hold this position, keeping your body straight and core tight.
Focus on maintaining perfect form, no sagging hips.

name: Bird Dog Plank
instructions: Start in a high plank position.
Lift one arm straight forward and the opposite leg straight back simultaneously.
Maintain a rigid body, minimizing any hip sway or torso rotation.
Hold briefly, then lower with control and switch sides.

name: Ankle Touches (Lying Oblique Crunch)
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, heels close to your glutes.
Lift your head and shoulders slightly off the floor, engaging your abs.
Reach one hand towards the ankle on the same side, crunching your obliques.
Return to the center and immediately reach for the other ankle, alternating sides.

name: Leg Bicycle Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back, hands behind your head, legs lifted with knees bent at 90 degrees.
Bring one elbow towards the opposite knee while extending the other leg straight.
Twist your torso to meet the knee. Immediately switch sides in a fluid, pedaling motion.
Keep your lower back pressed into the floor.

name: Standing Band Abduction
instructions: Loop a small resistance band around your ankles or just above your knees.
Stand tall, slight bend in knees, core engaged.
Slowly lift one leg directly out to the side, feeling the squeeze in your side glute.
Keep your hips level and avoid leaning. Lower with control and repeat.

name: Wrist Curls (Dumbbell)
instructions: Sit with your forearm resting on your thigh, wrist off the knee.
Hold a light dumbbell. Allow your wrist to extend down.
**Palm Up:** Curl the dumbbell up towards your forearm, squeezing the top of your forearm.
**Palm Down:** Curl the dumbbell up, squeezing the underside of your forearm.
Perform both variations for each wrist.

name: Neck Rotation and Flexion (Gentle)
instructions: Stand or sit tall with a relaxed posture.
Slowly tilt your head, bringing your ear towards your shoulder.
Gently rotate your head from side to side.
Then, slowly nod your head up and down (flexion/extension).
Perform all movements slowly and deliberately, within a pain-free range.

name: Dynamic Quad Stretch (Standing)
instructions: Stand tall, hold onto something for balance.
Grab one foot and pull your heel towards your glute, feeling a stretch in the front of your thigh.
Hold briefly, then release and kick the leg forward gently.
Alternate or complete reps on one leg before switching.

name: Scorpion Stretch (Prone)
instructions: Lie face down, arms out to the sides like a 'T', palms down.
Lift one leg, bend the knee, and try to bring that foot over your body to touch the opposite hand.
Allow your hips to rotate but try to keep your shoulders on the ground.
Hold briefly, then slowly return and repeat on the other side.

name: Bird-Dog Crunch
instructions: Start on all fours. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg straight back.
Simultaneously bring the extended elbow and knee together underneath your body, touching if possible.
Extend them back out with control, then return to the starting position.
Maintain a flat back throughout.
